de.piratenpartei.id.vote

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.piratenpartei.id.vote.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    A signed message that is used to communicate with any kind of service. Every Message is associated to an Account. The account supplies the key for verifying the message. Messages that were created by a PrivateAccount can be send. The sending process adds a signature to the message text.
    Author:
    arne

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message(java.io.InputStream in)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               IllegalFormatException,
               KeyException,
               VerificationException
        Loads a message from a given input stream. Use this for received messages.
        Parameters:
        in - to load the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the stream could not be read properly.
        KeyException - if something is fishy with the key.
        IllegalFormatException - if the input data has the wrong format.
        VerificationException - if the signature of the message could not be validated.

      • Message

        public Message(Account author)
        Creates a new empty message. If the author is a PrivateAccount, the message can be send.
        Parameters:
        author -

    • Method Detail

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Fetches the message text.
        Returns:
        the message text.

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the message text (without signature information etc.)
        Parameters:
        message - the new message text.

      • getAuthor

        public Account getAuthor()
        Returns the author of the message.
        Returns:
        the author

      • send

        public void send(java.io.PrintWriter ps)
          throws KeyException
        Sends the message. To be precise, writes the content of the message to a PrintWriter which is then responsible for sending the message to its destination. Make sure that the PrintWriter is writing in UTF8!
        Parameters:
        ps - the PrintWriter to write the message to.
        Throws:
        KeyException - if the author has not a private key, i.e. if the author is not a PrivateAccount
